result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kayla Michelle Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kayla Michelle Williams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Kayla Michelle Williams.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State moves to administratively close this matter.  Court ordered CASE CLOSED.

Upon request from the Defense, Court rescheduled Doctor's Report Return to October 21, 2022 at 1:30 PM.  Doctor Daniel Stabin confirmed availability for Zoom appearance.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.

Defendant Kayla Michelle Williams in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Kayla Michelle Williams in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Sworn for the State: Dr. Sanchez. Exhibit #1 received. Testimony closed. Statements by parties.
Court finds that the defendant remains incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within the statutory time frame. Court does not find the four Sell factors have been met for the involuntary administration of medication. Case adourned for return on doctor report, Branch 2.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kayla Michelle Williams in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Kayla Michelle Williams in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: cmt
Hearing held by Zoom. Doctor's report received and filed. State does not contest findings, however Defense contest findings and requests a hearing. Case scheduled for competency hearing, Branch 2.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Due to rotation changes, Return on doctor report moved from 07-25-2022 to 07-29-2022 at 8:30 am by Zoom.

Case calendared for a competency review hearing  on 7-28-2022 at 1:30pm,  Per email from Attorney Golden and confirmed by Judge childs.
Defendant misdemeanor case before Branch 19 will be heard alongside defendant pending felony matter before Branch 2 on 7-28-2022 at 8:30am.
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency), filed.

Defendant Kayla Michelle Williams in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Kayla Michelle Williams in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kayla Michelle Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for return on doctors report.  
Parties review and do not contest Doctor Jenna Niess Report dated 04/26/2022.  Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care FORTHWITH in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame. Defendant has agreed to take madications voluntarily.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Review earing in Branch 19.  Review hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kayla Michelle Williams in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Kayla Michelle Williams in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kayla Michelle Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
